text: Joseph Benjamin "Joe" Wilder (February 22, 1922 - May 9, 2014) was an American jazz trumpeter, bandleader, and composer. He performed music with people such as Dizzy Gillespie, Billie Holiday, Johnny Mathis, Harry Belafonte and Tony Bennett. He was honored with the NEA Jazz Masters Award by the National Endowment for the Arts in 2008. Wilder was an African American who was born in Colwyn, Pennsylvania and raised in Philadelphia. Wilder died from congestive heart failure on May 9, 2014 in New York City. He was 92. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1922 births Category:2014 deaths Category:African-American musicians Category:American composers Category:Bandleaders Category:Deaths from congestive heart failure Category:Musicians from Philadelphia Category:American trumpeters
title: Joe Wilder
